intro: Gnaphalium buchtormense, commonly known as the Buchtormense cudweed, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow florets surrounded by pale green or white bracts. The plant typically forms a mat-like growth, with slender, often hairy stems and small, narrow leaves. It is native to arctic and alpine regions of Europe and is adapted to cold, dry environments. Gnaphalium buchtormense is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, high-altitude conditions.
